messages.subject: Dishwashers and Chores still
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/6/01 3:20:15 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... I didn t realize I was going to have to think so much (LOL).  I ve always prided myself on
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/6/01 3:20:15 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> As with all great questions, the answer is "it depends."
>
I didn't realize I was going to have to think so much (LOL). I've always
prided myself on being such a great communicator, but maybe I'm not with my
kids. We don't really have any structure when it comes to chores and I don't
know if that is a good thing or not. Sometimes he empties it, sometimes he
sets the table, sometimes he puts his clothes away, sometimes he sorts the
laundry. I think it has depended on what mood I've been in as to whether I
ask for his help or not.... Hmmmm going to have to think more about this now.

Dawn

"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school."-George
Bernard Shaw
